result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie Ladwan Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING 3/23/15 AT 8:15 A.M. IN BR. 38.

miscConds.notes: Pay victim witness surcharges and all costs, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in entry of a civil judgment.

Provide DNA sample, pay costs.
Court advised defendant:   that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
No further violations of the law.

Follow all rules of probation.
Other counseling needs to be determined.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Ladwan Reed

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Willie Ladwan Reed in court.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agent Erwin Butler appears.  Court stays condition time until the expiration of his probation.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.

Defendant Willie Ladwan Reed in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 17.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by counsels.  Defendant does not address the court.
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 10 months in the House of Correction; credit for 3 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-Serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, STAYED for review on 3-23-2015 at 8:15am Branch 38.
-Follow all rules of probation.
-No further violations of the law.
-AODA assessment and any treatment.
-Other counseling needs to be determined.
-Perform 36 HOURS of community service at a non-profit agency.
-Pay victim witness surcharge and all costs, assessments and surcharges.
-Provide DNA sample and pay costs.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL COSTS ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.
 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement previously filed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Sheet filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated September 22, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Willie Ladwan Reed in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case scheduled for Jury Trial. Case proceeds to Plea Hearing. 
Defendant sworn in. 
AS TO COUNT  1 of the AMENDED INFORMATION- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing on 9-23-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.

On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession of THC (Tetrahydrocannabinols) - 2nd and Subsequent Offense, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 961.41(3g)(3), (939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated August 26, 2014, received and filed.
from Defense Attorney Detert, received and filed.
State's Witness List, State's Requested Jury Instructions, and State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Willie Ladwan Reed in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial held. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 8-27-2014 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.
Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions and Defendant's Witness List, received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated August 20, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Willie Ladwan Reed in court with attorney Eugene E Detert.  Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp   Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the safety building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie Ladwan Reed in court with attorney Eugene E Detert.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-03-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie Ladwan Reed in court with attorney Eugene E Detert.  Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant Willie Ladwan Reed in court with attorney Eugene E Detert.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Williamson).

Defendant Willie Ladwan Reed in court with attorney Eugene E Detert.  Randy Sitzberger for Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/11/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Willie Ladwan Reed in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Willie Ladwan Reed in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
